definitions.definition: a small container that has a measured amount of a medicine inside and that dissolves (= becomes part of a liquid) when you swallow it (= make it go down your throat into your stomach)

examples.text: The medicine can be taken in tablet or capsule form.

definitions.definition: a small plastic container with a substance or liquid inside

examples.text: To avoid capture, he swallowed a cyanide capsule.

definitions.definition: the part of a spacecraft in which people travel and that often separates from the main rocket

examples.text: the cramped conditions of a space capsule

definitions.definition: a shell or container for seeds or eggs in some plants and animals

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the general sense ‘small container’): via French from Latin capsula, diminutive of capsa related to capere ‘to hold’.
